mount-bond.prep_notes: Check a summit forecast and carry windproof/warm layers; turn back if visibility or lightning risk increases. Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: High - long stretches above treeline along exposed ridges.
Long, remote approach on old railroad grade followed by gradual climb; rocky alpine ridge with open ledges and talus
High - fully exposed ridge.
Limited – the last reliable water is a stream on Bondcliff Trail about 3 miles in; none on the ridge
Spotty/None – AMC notes less than half of the Pemigewasset Wilderness has cell service
Minor – rocky steps but no technical scrambles
Long, remote approach on old railroad grade followed by gradual climb; rocky alpine ridge with open ledges and talus
Navigation added due to AboveTreelineExposure or (NoCellService+LongBailout)

primary_route.Route Name: Bunnell Notch Trail → Kilkenny Ridge Trail

mount-cabot.prep_notes: Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: Limited – streams along Bunnell Notch Trail but no potable water at Cabot Cabin
Spotty/None – remote range; cell service generally unreliable

primary_route.Route Name: Flume Slide Trail → Liberty Spring Trail → Franconia Ridge - loop with Mount Liberty.

mount-flume.prep_notes: Check a summit forecast and carry windproof/warm layers; turn back if visibility or lightning risk increases. Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: High on Flume Slide and summit; moderate on Liberty Spring approach
Long approach on old road, then extremely steep and loose rock slabs on Flume Slide; Liberty Spring route is more gradual but rocky
High - exposed ledges and open summit.
Yes – lower Flume Slide Trail follows a brook and Liberty Spring has water; none on the summit ridge
Poor – the Pemigewasset Wilderness generally lacks cell service
Yes – the Flume Slide requires class 2–3 scrambling on slick rock slabs
Long approach on old road, then extremely steep and loose rock slabs on Flume Slide; Liberty Spring route is more gradual but rocky

primary_route.Route Name: Hancock Loop Trail - via Hancock Notch & Cedar Brook.

mount-hancock-south.prep_notes: Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: Yes – streams along Hancock Notch and Cedar Brook Trails during the first half of the loop; none on the ridge
None/Spotty – deep in the Pemigewasset Wilderness where cell service is patchy
Minor – steep hiking on loose scree but no technical hand‑and‑foot scrambling
Long flat approach along the North Fork of Hancock Branch with several brook crossings, followed by a very steep climb on loose gravel to the ridge and a steep descent from South Hancock

primary_route.Route Name: Mount Osceola Trail - Tripoli Road.

mount-osceola.prep_notes: Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: Limited – small brooks near the trailhead; no reliable water on the ridge
Spotty – proximity to Waterville Valley ski area provides occasional signal but it is unreliable
Yes – the ‘Chimney’ between East and main peaks requires class 2–3 scrambling; a bypass exists
Well‑graded path from Tripoli Road with moderate rocky sections; via Greeley Ponds it is steeper and rougher and includes the rock chimney between peaks

primary_route.Route Name: Greeley Ponds Trail → Mount Osceola Trail - via East Peak.

mount-osceola-east.prep_notes: Plan water conservatively and do not assume reliable sources late in the hike. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: Limited – small brooks near trailheads; no water on the ridge
Spotty – some signal near Tripoli Road but little on the ridge
Yes – the chimney between peaks is a steep rock chute requiring class 2–3 scrambling
Steep, rocky ridge connecting from the main peak with a rock chimney requiring hands or bypass; footing is rough and slippery when wet

primary_route.Route Name: Lonesome Lake Trail → Cascade Brook Trail → Fishin’ Jimmy Trail → Kinsman Ridge Trail
primary_route.Trail Type: Out & back - continuing over South Kinsman.

north-kinsman-mountain.trail_type_primary: Out & back - continuing over South Kinsman.
north-kinsman-mountain.prep_notes: Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: Spotty – some signal near Franconia Notch and at the viewpoint, generally weak elsewhere
Minor – steep rock slabs require hands in places but wood steps aid the ascent
Steady climb to Lonesome Lake followed by rough, rooty Fishin’ Jimmy Trail with rock steps and bolted wooden steps on steep slabs; final ridge climb is steep but manageable

primary_route.Route Name: Wildcat Ridge Trail - via Glen Ellis Falls.

wildcat-mountain-d.prep_notes: Check a summit forecast and carry windproof/warm layers; turn back if visibility or lightning risk increases. Download offline maps and do not rely on cell service; leave a plan with someone.

risk_evidence.value: High on Wildcat Ridge Trail due to steep ledges; moderate via ski trail
Steep climb from Glen Ellis Falls with immediate ascent up rocky ledges; Wildcat Ridge is rugged with constant ups and downs; ski trail is grassy and gradual
High - steep ledges and exposed sections.
Spotty – some signal near Pinkham Notch and the ski area but unreliable on the ridge
Yes – Wildcat Ridge Trail includes class 2 scrambles and steep ledges requiring hands
